page.title: 04Gt.Bromley:Farming Year 1985
page.content: The{Winter}of 1984/85 was particularly severe, with many weeks of{frost &snow.}Several farmers in our survey had to carry water by hand to their livestock. {June}has been the{wettest since {1887.120.7mm.of rain fell.}The average for this month is 40mm.The cereal yield could be halved due to{mildew & {fungus.}The hay has rotted & some fields of potatoes have been ploughed back into the soil as it was too wet to lift them.In early June a freak {hailstorm}flattened cereals in places. Farmers are worried that the present artificially high prices for cereal prices will drop.At present the Common Agricultural Policy of The European Economic Community ensures that farmers recieve payment for their surpluses.There is now a European wide {glut of cereal crops.
